intro: Dalechampia anisophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Dalechampia anisophylla is often found in lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in warm, moist climates.
